title: Connections panel scrolling down when focussed
author: rzuidhof
body_snippet:
Sometimes my Connections panel keeps scrolling down when it has focus from the mouse pointer. Clicking or selecting with arrow keys is still possible but with a long list a groups the top ones will disappear from view fast.

Using mRemoteNG 1.76.20 on Windows Server 2012 R2. I think it also happened with previous releases.

Frequency is hard to tell, maybe once every two months? Restarting the application fixes the issue.

iterations.description: The Connections panel (ConnectionTree, a TreeListView) scrolls unnecessarily when a node gains focus, likely due to an aggressive auto-scroll-on-focus behavior in the underlying TreeListView control.

Do I understand it correctly, that the connection panel scrolls even though the mouse wheel is not touched? 
It is wanted behavior that it scrolls when the mouse hovers the list and the scroll wheel is moved, but as soon as the wheel is stopped the scrolling should stop as well...

comments.author: antonostrovsky
comments.snippet: Same here: 1.76.20.24615. But I've found a workaround: collapse all your folders (if any) and change the order of elements in the connection tree. The scrolling stops

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The Connections panel (ConnectionTree, a TreeListView) scrolls unnecessarily when a node gains focus, likely due to an aggressive auto-scroll-on-focus behavior in the underlying TreeListView control.
Approach: Investigate and disable or modify the TreeListView's auto-scroll-on-focus behavior in ConnectionTree.cs to prevent unwanted scrolling while ensuring the focused item remains visible when necessary (e.g., after adding a new node).
